page.title: 04SHERBURN HOSPITAL
page.content: This was originally a hospital but was converted into a private old peoples home.It caters for approximately 60 residents.The grounds are famed for the annual display of daffodils.There are two main buildings for housing the residents.Facilities include self contained flats for some of the residents as well as the normal method of looking after the elderly.Trained nurses are available as well as many other workers both paid and voluntary.The person in charge is called the master and he has his own detached accomodation within the grounds.There is also a chapel in front of the masters house.Another prominent feature of the building is the beautiful gatehouse.
